original: BERNHULT, Eric Robert Teodor, Civilingenjör, Hagfors, f Skara 26/1 95 av godsäg A Johansson o Amanda Engblad, gm Irma Sterner. Studex, CTH. Anst s konstr, verkst. -ing o montageing i Tyskl 22—23 o USA 23—29, ing v SKF Hofors Bruk 29—35, ing v Uddeholms AB Hagfors järnv sed. 35. Resor: Norge 30, 39, Danm 14, 37, Engl 23, Tyskl 14, 21, 22—23, USA 23—29. Av trycket: Div smärre upps i tekn tidskr. Hobbies: Friluftsliv, fiske, bridge. °BERNSTRÖM, Erik Andreas, fd Kapten, Direktör, Djursholm, f Gbg 27/8 75 av grhdl A B o Anna Sundström, gm (2) Ellen Romberg. Ulöjtn v Flottan 96, GCI 98—00, löjtn 00, KSHS 02—04, AIHS h kurs 04—06, kapt 04, i res 10. Vkst dir AB Separator 15—22, led av krigsberedsk.komm 16—17, av 17 års bkkomm, gen.kommiss f världsutst i Rio 22, styr.led k teatern 23—39 o ordf i sakk betr k teat:s ekon mm 23—24, stat jourhav dir AB Vin- & Spritcentr 24—30, 2:a kamm (h) 25—28, sakk betr arb.losh.försäkr 26—28, betr skydd f äldre kulturföremål 28—29, betr rev av rusdryckslagstiftn 30—34. Ordf Frn 75 års män sed. 17, Djursh borgeri frn 26—31, styr.led KAK 19—38, 2:e v. ordf 33—38, ständ hed.-led sed. 38, ordf nät tävl.nmnd f auto- o mo-torcykeltävl i Sv 30—31, KVO2kl, RNO, KNS:tOO; KAK :s förtjGM, Sv Skidfrbs GM, Sv central.frns f idr främj GM, iclrm g.
translated:
BERNHULT, Eric Robert Teodor, Civil Engineer, Hagfors, b. Skara 26/1 1895, son of landowner A Johansson and Amanda Engblad, m. Irma Sterner. Grad. Eng., Chalmers University of Technology. Employed as a construction, engineering, and assembly engineer in Germany 1922-1923 and USA 1923-1929, engineer at SKF Hofors Bruk 1929-1935, engineer at Uddeholm AB Hagfors ironworks since 1935. Travels: Norway 1930, 1939, Denmark 1914, 1937, England 1923, Germany 1914, 1921, 1922-1923, USA 1923-1929. Published several small technical articles. Hobbies: Outdoor activities, fishing, bridge.

°BERNSTRÖM, Erik Andreas, retired Captain, Director, Djursholm, b. Gothenburg 27/8 1875, son of wholesale merchant A B and Anna Sundström, m. (2) Ellen Romberg. Sublieutenant in the Navy 1896, graduate of the Royal Military College 1898-1900, lieutenant 1900, graduate of the Royal Swedish Army Staff College 1902-1904, advanced course at the Army Intelligence and Security School 1904-1906, Captain 1904, on reserve duty from 1910. Vice Director of AB Separator 1915-1922, member of the War Preparedness Committee 1916-1917, member of the 17-year book committee, general commissioner for the World Exhibition in Rio 1922, board member of the theater 1923-1939, chairman of the committee on theater finance 1923-1924, temporary director of AB Vin- & Spiritcentr (Alcohol & Spirits) 1924-1930, member of the Second Chamber of the Swedish Parliament (Conservative) 1925-1928, expert on unemployment insurance 1926-1928, expert on the protection of ancient cultural objects 1928-1929, expert on the revision of the alcoholic beverage legislation 1930-1934. Chairman of the Association of Men Turning 75 since 1917, Djursholm Citizen Council member 1926-1931, board member of the Royal Automobile Club 1919-1938, deputy chairman 1933-1938, perpetual honorary member since 1938, chairman of the network competition committee for car and motorcycle racing in Sweden 1930-1931, Knight of the Royal Order of Vasa, Commander of the Royal Norwegian Order, Commander of the Order of the North Star, Twelfth Distinction Gold Medal of the Royal Automobile Club, Gold Medal of the Swedish Ski Association, Gold Medal of the Swedish Central Assembly for the Promotion of Sports, honorary member of the International Court of Law.
